components.description:
A pot, as a casserole dish, filled with a warm and hearty beef or vegetable stew on most platforms. Generally used for eating and cooking (“a meal”), and commonly associated with soup or Japanese nabe.

Samsung’s design previously resembled a bowl of ramen or other noodle dish, with chopsticks.
components.title: Pot of Food

description:
A pot, as a casserole dish, filled with a warm and hearty beef or vegetable stew on most platforms. Generally used for eating and cooking (“a meal”), and commonly associated with soup or Japanese nabe.

Samsung’s design previously resembled a bowl of ramen or other noodle dish, with chopsticks.
title: Pot of Food

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Food symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A pot containing a variety of food. Pot of Food was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste t http://emojipedia.org/pot-of-food/
emoji_net_data.name: pot of food

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00789641n: A Japanese noodle called oolong in Chinese
Udon is a type of thick wheat flour noodle of Japanese cuisine.
A type of thick noodle in Japanese cuisine made out of wheat flour, salt and water.

bn:00063820n: Any vessel (such as a saucepan), with or without a lid, used to cook food
A cylindrical receptacle about as tall as it is wide, with one long handle, usually made of metal, used for cooking in the home
Cylindrical receptacle with one long handle.
Cookware and bakeware are types of food preparation containers, commonly found in a kitchen.
Metal or earthenware cooking vessel that is usually round and deep; often has a handle and lid
A generic kitchen utensil used for cooking food by boiling, frying or other methods.

bn:00072921n: The liquid part of such a dish; the broth.
Soup is a primarily liquid food, generally served warm, that is made by combining ingredients such as meat and vegetables with stock, juice, water, or another liquid.
Liquid food especially of meat or fish or vegetable stock often containing pieces of solid food
A cooked, liquid dish (made from meat or vegetables that are mixed with broth in a pot) that is often sold in tins.

bn:00074241n: Combination of solid food ingredients that have been cooked in liquid and served in the resultant gravy
Food prepared by stewing especially meat or fish with vegetables
A stew is a combination of solid food ingredients that have been cooked in liquid and served in the resultant gravy.

bn:00035650n: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

apple_vendor_description: The pot of food emoji on Apple devices presents a charming, rustic cauldron brimming with a hearty stew, rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading and realistic lighting.  Its smooth, rounded edges and vibrant, appetizing colors evoke a sense of warmth and comfort, perfect for sharing a delicious meal or expressing contentment.  This emoji on Apple devices symbolizes nourishment, home-cooked meals, or a gathering around good food.
